revised_title: The Evolution of Pallial Organs and Mantle Cavity in Mollusca
tldr: The article studies the pallial organs and their evolution in the aspidobranch Gastropoda, as well as their role in the mantle cavity. The authors discuss the functions of ctenidia, hypobranchial glands, and osphradia, and how they form a functional unit. They also explore the evolution of the mantle cavity and its adaptations in different Mollusca groups, such as pectinibranchs, Scaphopoda, and Lamellibranchia.
